Control.Text: Are you sure you want to copy settings from the %s addons selected above from %s to your current character, %s?
Control.Name: AreYouSure

Control.Text: THE CURRENT SETTINGS ON THIS CHARACTER WILL BE LOST
Control.Name: Window

Control.Text: Log onto other characters to add additional profiles to the list above.
Control.Name: CharacterList1

Control.Text: Select a character above to see the list of addons saved, then select by clicking the addons on the right to begin copying.
Control.Name: CharacterList2

Control.Text: Settings copy has been disabled until a future 2.8.x update. When I restructured the PotatoUI elements into their own addon folders (making the UI modular), it broke the copy settings feature. HOWEVER, this is fortunate because I will be redoing the settings copy to be more like "profile" system. You can have separate profiles for LAS builds, and have PotatoUIs for each profile. For example, you can have a "tanking" PUI and a "DPS" PUI; and when you switch between the associated LAS, it will switch the PUI as well.
Control.Name: Content1

Control.Text: Pressing "Yes" will reset ALL of the PotatoUI addons and is undoable. Are you sure you want to reset the PotatoUI settings?
Control.Name: Window
MouseCatch
Control.Tooltip: General PotatoUI settings.

Control.Name: MouseCatch
Control.Tooltip: The new profiling system will be found here.

Control.Name: MouseCatch
Control.Tooltip: Select colors for class display options.

Control.Name: MouseCatch
Control.Tooltip: Enable or disable certain features without having to unload the addons.

Control.Text: Welcome to the NEW PotatoUI Settings window. This is where all customization will take place in the next few updates. Please bear with this extra window for the time being, as PotatoUI becomes a little bit sexier.
Control.Name: Window1
ResetFeaturesBtn
Control.Tooltip: Used to reset features to default settings. Useful for restoring lost frames.

Control.Name: ForcedEditorSave
Control.Tooltip: This option forces a ReloadUI when leaving editor mode. Ensures saving of data in the event of a disconnection or game crash. **SACRIFICES PERFORMANCE** as each time editor mode is left, the game will reload the entire UI.

Control.Name: OldPUIToolbox
Control.Tooltip: This disables the dropdown PUI menu and re-enables the old PUI toolbox which has to be toggled with /pui or /potatoui.

Control.Text: The AWFUL Dropdown Will (Optionally) Be Back Soon!
Control.Name: Coverup
FramePositionBase
Control.Tooltip: This option changes the way the X/Y position is displayed when editing a frame. It bases it off the center of the screen, rather than the top left corner. **This does not move frames.**

Control.Name: TruncateText
Control.Tooltip: The option truncates long text fields and sets their tooltip to the full text, so that it does not overlap other text on the frame. (0.020ms/frame/unitframe loss.)

Control.Name: LowHPandCC
Control.Text: TEMPORARY: Show Different Colors for Low HP and MoO
Control.Tooltip: **TEMPORARY** This will show different HP colors for HP values <30%, and when a unit is stunned with a moment of opportunity (MoO).

Control.Name: FeatureName
Control.Tooltip: The feature. For example: Resource = PUI Resource Bar.

Control.Name: Enabled
Control.Tooltip: Disable to replace PUI version with Carbine version.

Control.Name: RetainCarbine
Control.Tooltip: Keep the Carbine version, while still using the PUI version.

Control.Name: FeatureName
Control.Tooltip: The feature. For example: Resource = PUI Resource Bar.

Control.Name: FeatureName1
Control.Tooltip: The feature. For example: Resource = PUI Resource Bar.

Control.Text: OH NO! Why does this frame look different? Well, that's because PUI is on it's way to gettin' sexy.
